headline: Trump Thanks an Ohio GOP Candidate for Quitting Senate Race
author: NationalWatch
sentences:
(AP Photo/Ben Gray, File)
By Jeffrey Rodack | Friday, 04 February 2022 09:28 AM
Former President Donald Trump praised businessman Bernie Moreno for dropping out of the Republican primary for an Ohio Senate seat.
Trump Thanks an Ohio GOP Candidate for Quitting Senate Race Former President Donald Trump prepares to take the stage during a rally in Perry, Ga., on Sept. 25, 2021.
Joe Biden is the result of socialist policies infiltrating our institutions and the Senate is the stopgap to prevent Washington, DC from spiraling out of control.
“I was very impressed with Bernie who was tough on illegal immigration which, after the Biden disaster at the Border, has become a big issue for all candidates.
“Bernie Moreno of Ohio is leaving the race for Senate, but I would like to thank him for his time and effort and that of his wonderful family,” Trump said.
We must regain control of the United States Senate and eliminate the possibility of career DC politicians like [Rep.] Tim Ryan from representing Ohio.
After talking to President Trump we both agreed this race has too many Trump candidates and could cost the MAGA movement a conservative seat.
"This race was never about fulfilling a personal ambition, but rather about serving the Country that gave me every opportunity to succeed.
Moreno, in a statement said: “I asked for a private meeting with President Trump to discuss the state of the Ohio Senate race.

Thank you, Bernie, for your support and keep fighting!”
Moreno’s decision to quit the race came after a meeting with Trump.

I will focus my efforts on supporting the candidate that wins President Trump’s endorsement.”
Original Article
“Therefore, today I am ending my U.S. Senate campaign and will return to the private sector.
His decision will help ensure the MAGA Ticket wins BIG, as it is all over the Country.
He has done much for Ohio and loves his State and our great MAGA Movement.
Trump made his remarks in a statement released on Friday.
Business leaders recognize patterns before they happen.
I am a businessman, not a politician.
